It is characterized by its dense, crust-like growth form and typically grows on rock surfaces in arid or semi-arid environments. The thallus is usually pale to dark gray, with a firm and leathery texture. It lacks distinct lobes and has a uniform appearance, making it easily identifiable in its habitat. This lichen is often found in regions with low humidity and high sunlight exposure.

It thrives in sandy soils and is commonly found in desert and steppe environments. This species is well adapted to harsh climatic conditions with low rainfall and high temperatures. It is often seen growing along dunes and in open grasslands. Its distribution is largely restricted to these specific ecological zones within Central Asia.
